SEARCH
Package ca.jolt.form

Interface Rule

All Known Implementing Classes:
AsyncRule
public interface Rule
Represents a general validation rule for form fields. Classes implementing this interface should define how to validate the field value based on all available form data, and provide an error message for invalid cases.

The validate(String) method is used by Form or other components to determine if a field is valid, while getErrorMessage() provides the text to display if the validation fails.

Note: The actual method signature in this interface is validate(String), which performs the validation check on the field value alone. Implementations may choose to reference additional data as needed.

Since:
1.0
Author:
William

  • Method Details

    • validate

      boolean validate(String data)
      Validates the field value.

      Implementations typically check data (the current field's value).

      Parameters:
      data - The field value to validate
      Returns:
      true if the field value passes validation; false otherwise

    • getErrorMessage

      String getErrorMessage()
      Returns a human-readable error message indicating why the validation failed. This message is typically displayed if validate(String) returns false.
      Returns:
      The error message to display on validation failure

    • custom

      static Rule custom(Predicate<String> predicate, String errorMessage)
      Factory method to create a new Rule based on a Predicate.

      This allows quick, in-line creation of simple validation rules without writing a separate class. The predicate should return true if the data is valid, or false otherwise.

      Parameters:
      predicate - A Predicate that takes the field value, returning true for valid data or false for invalid data
      errorMessage - A string representing the validation error message if the predicate fails
      Returns:
      A new Rule instance wrapping the given predicate and error message
